pageTitle: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau speaks with Ursula von der Leyen, President of the European Commission | Prime Minister of Canada
articleHtml:
Today, Prime Minister Justin Trudeau spoke with the President of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, who called at the outset of her mandate at the European Commission.

Prime Minister Trudeau congratulated President von der Leyen. Building on the strategic partnership between Canada and the EU, they discussed shared priorities on climate action, economic growth that benefits everyone, democracy, digital policy and the rules-based international order. 

Prime Minister Trudeau and President von der Leyen committed to continue working together on this shared agenda and looked forward to strengthening cooperation going forward, including in multilateral fora such as the G7 and G20.  They agreed to stay in touch and to explore new areas of alignment.
